title: Induced emf - emf dependence on time

content.description: A square conducting loop with sides of length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> is placed in a magnetic field initially of magnitude <math alttext="B sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> that is directed out of the page, as shown. The area vector of the loop is parallel to the field. In Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the magnetic field is increased according to <math alttext="B sub 1 equals, B sub 0 plus alpha t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>α</mi><mi>t</mi></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> is a positive constant and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is time. In Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the magnetic field is increased according to the function <math alttext="B sub 2 equals, B sub 0 plus beta times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>β</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>β</mi></math> is a positive constant. Which of the following claims about <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> and <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><msub><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mi>Ɛ</mi></mstyle><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math>, the absolute value of the induced <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> in scenarios <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively, is true?
content.question: Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>A<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> is constant<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><msub><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mi>Ɛ</mi></mstyle><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> is constantB<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> is constant<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><msub><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mi>Ɛ</mi></mstyle><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> increases over timeC<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> increases over time<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><msub><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mi>Ɛ</mi></mstyle><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> is constantD<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> increases over time<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><msub><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mi>Ɛ</mi></mstyle><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> increases over time

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
